      void assignAudience(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Assign audience.

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/assign

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The logged in user SirqulKeys.audienceIds
      A list of audience IDs to assign SirqulKeys.ids
      A list of ids to assign the audiences to SirqulKeys.suggestionType
      The object type to assign the audiences to; Offer, OfferLocation, Mission SirqulKeys.assign
      If true add the audiences to the suggestionType, if false then remove the assignment if possible SirqulKeys.removeOld
      Determines whether to remove the old audience references
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
      void assignmentAudience(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Retrieve assignments that have been attached to an audience.

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/assignments

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The logged in user SirqulKeys.audienceId
      The audience ID to get assignments for SirqulKeys.suggestionType
      The object type to retrieve assignments: OfferLocation, Mission
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
      void createAudience(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<AudienceResponse>> callback)
      Create a user defined audience.

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/create

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The logged in user. SirqulKeys.name
      The name of the audience SirqulKeys.gender
      The gender; possible values are: MALE, FEMALE, ANY SirqulKeys.ageGroups
      The list of age groups, comma separated; possible values are:
      AGE_0_13, AGE_14_17, AGE_18_22, AGE_23_30, AGE_31_54, AGE_55_PLUS SirqulKeys.interestIds
      The list of interests ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/interests getInterests(Map, ISirqulCallback) (pass in id values) SirqulKeys.applicationIds
      The list of application ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /application/list getApplicationList (pass in id values) SirqulKeys.gameExperienceLevel
      The experience level of the player; possible values are:
      ANY, NEW, BEGINNER, INTERMEDIATE, EXPERT SirqulKeys.devices
      The list of targeted device names, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/devices (pass in name values) SirqulKeys.deviceVersions
      The list of targeted device version ranges that are aligned with the provided devices list (see devices param for possible values), comma separated; examples are:
      2.3-X, 0-5.1.4, 4.3.1-6.1.4 where X is no maximum and 0 is no minimum. SirqulKeys.radius
      The radius of influence for the audience, in miles. SirqulKeys.locations
      The list of locations to build the center around; comma seperated list of latitude/longitude pairs.

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/ageGroups

      Available parameters for this api
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a ListResponse< AgeGroupResponse> containing the various age groups on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message

      void getAudienceList(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<List<AudienceResponse>>> callback)
      Get the list audiences owned by the account

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/search

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The logged in user. SirqulKeys.keyword
      The keyword used to search SirqulKeys.sortField
      The field to sort by, possible values include: {ID, CREATED, UPDATED, DELETED, SEARCH_TAGS, ACTIVE, NAME, DESCRIPTION, OWNER_ID, OWNER_DISPLAY,GENDER} SirqulKeys.descending
      The order to return the results.

      void getInterests(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<ListResponse<InterestResponse>> callback)
      Gets the list of available interests that can be selected by consumers and retailers targeting offers.

      Target API Endpoint: /audience/interests

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.requireAsset
      If true then only return interests with assets, otherwise return all

      a ListResponse<InterestResponse> on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message

    • Method Detail

      • assignAudience

        public void assignAudience(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Assign audience.

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/assign

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user
        • SirqulKeys.audienceIds
          A list of audience IDs to assign
        • SirqulKeys.ids
          A list of ids to assign the audiences to
        • SirqulKeys.suggestionType
          The object type to assign the audiences to; Offer, OfferLocation, Mission
        • SirqulKeys.assign
          If true add the audiences to the suggestionType, if false then remove the assignment if possible
        • SirqulKeys.removeOld
          Determines whether to remove the old audience references

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.assignAudience

With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • createAudience

        public void createAudience(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<AudienceResponse>> callback)
        Create a user defined audience.

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the audience
        • SirqulKeys.gender
          The gender; possible values are: MALE, FEMALE, ANY
        • SirqulKeys.ageGroups
          The list of age groups, comma separated; possible values are:
          AGE_0_13, AGE_14_17, AGE_18_22, AGE_23_30, AGE_31_54, AGE_55_PLUS
        • SirqulKeys.interestIds
          The list of interests ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/interests getInterests(Map, ISirqulCallback) (pass in id values)
        • SirqulKeys.applicationIds
          The list of application ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /application/list getApplicationList (pass in id values)
        • SirqulKeys.gameExperienceLevel
          The experience level of the player; possible values are:
          ANY, NEW, BEGINNER, INTERMEDIATE, EXPERT
        • SirqulKeys.devices
          The list of targeted device names, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/devices (pass in name values)
        • SirqulKeys.deviceVersions
          The list of targeted device version ranges that are aligned with the provided devices list (see devices param for possible values), comma separated; examples are:
          2.3-X, 0-5.1.4, 4.3.1-6.1.4 where X is no maximum and 0 is no minimum.
        • SirqulKeys.radius
          The radius of influence for the audience, in miles.
        • SirqulKeys.locations
          The list of locations to build the center around; comma seperated list of latitude/longitude pairs. Example: lat1, long1, lat2, long2

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< AudienceResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.createAudience

      • getAudience

        public void getAudience(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<AudienceResponse>> callback)
        Get an audience. The audience and account must be valid and have the appropirate permissions to view the content.

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user's account id.
        • SirqulKeys.audienceId
          The id of the audience to return.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< AudienceResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.getAudience

      • getAudienceList

        public void getAudienceList(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<List<AudienceResponse>>> callback)
        Get the list audiences owned by the account

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The field to sort by, possible values include: {ID, CREATED, UPDATED, DELETED, SEARCH_TAGS, ACTIVE, NAME, DESCRIPTION, OWNER_ID, OWNER_DISPLAY,GENDER}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the results. Default is false, which will return the results in ascending order.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return.
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Determines whether to return only active results. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< List<AudienceResponse>>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.getAudienceList

      • sendByAccount

        public void sendByAccount(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<OfferListResponse> callback)
        Use the accountId to determine the associated BillableEntity. From there get a list of all triggers associated with the BillableEntity.

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/suggestion/send

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account to match offers for.
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success OfferListResponse
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.sendByAccount

      • updateAudience

        @Deprecated
public void updateAudience(Map<String,Object> params,
                             ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<AudienceResponse>> callback)
        Deprecated. 
        Update a user defined audience.

        Target API Endpoint: /audience/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.audienceId
          The id of the audience to update, leave null to create a new audience.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the audience
        • SirqulKeys.gender
          The gender; possible values are: MALE, FEMALE, ANY
        • SirqulKeys.ageGroups
          The list of age groups, comma separated; possible values are:
          AGE_0_13, AGE_14_17, AGE_18_22, AGE_23_30, AGE_31_54, AGE_55_PLUS
        • SirqulKeys.interestIds
          The list of interests ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /api/{version}/audience/interests getInterests(Map, ISirqulCallback) (pass in id values)
        • SirqulKeys.applicationIds
          The list of application ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /api/{version}/application/list getApplicationList (pass in id values)
        • SirqulKeys.gameExperienceLevel
          The experience level of the player; possible values are:
          ANY, NEW, BEGINNER, INTERMEDIATE, EXPERT
        • SirqulKeys.deviceIds
          the device ids
        • SirqulKeys.deviceVersions
          The list of targeted device version ranges that are aligned with the provided devices list (see devices param for possible values), comma separated; examples are:
          2.3-X, 0-5.1.4, 4.3.1-6.1.4 where X is no maximum and 0 is no minimum.
        • SirqulKeys.locations
          The list of locations to build the center around; comma seperated of latitude/longitude pairs.
        • SirqulKeys.radius
          The list of radius of influence for the audience, in miles; separated list. Either provide 1 to be applied to all location pairs or a matching list to each lat/long pair.
        • SirqulKeys.active
          the active
        • SirqulKeys.sendSuggestion
          If true, then notify matching users when they are inside the radius

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< AudienceResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AudienceApiBase.updateAudience
